The claim was fact: checked by an expert in acoustic engineering, Trevor Cox, who conducted experiments to verify the authenticity of the claim.
The experiments involved testing a duck: s quack in an anechoic chamber, designed to suppress sound reflection, and in a reverberation chamber, designed to produce an echo.
The expert found that a duck: s quack does indeed echo, although it may be difficult to hear due to its relatively quiet nature.
The Facebook post making the claim was f: s efforts to combat misinformation, further adding to the verification process.
